ajwieme at gmail dot com

I am a first year PhD student in Computer Science at The University of Colorado, Boulder, working under the supervision of Katharina Kann in the NALA lab. Before that I was a Data Scientist at Pearson, working on Natural Language Processing methods for assessing English language, in the context of educational applications.

My current research interests revolve around computational morphology (both inflectional and derivational), NLP systems geared towards underrepresented languages, and algorithms that explore or draw upon linguistic insights.
